Posts.Content: Aug 30, 2012 11:20AM lorimann wrote: The results were benign.  Thanks for the support. To those of you waiting or who didn't get this same news, my prayers are with you.
Posts.Title: Biopsy question lorimann artistang

Posts.Content: lorimann wrote: Hello, Another woman who's a bundle of nerves aawaiting biosy results, convinced I'll hear the worst.  It was recommended after finding microcalcifications on my (semi) annual mammogram (missed a year) and getting a diagnostic mammogram.  I'm wondering why some get an ultrasound, but that wasn't even offered to me?  I had the biopsy done Monday by a highly respected breast surgeon/oncologist recommended by my OB.  That also has me nervous because her nurse called several times Monday to find out how my consultation on Friday went.  When I mentioned that I already had the biopsy that morning, she sounded relieved and said  "I'm so glad you ended up getting in with that doctor; he's the best in town."  She could be trying to reassure me I'm in good hands, but it made me feel anxious she knew something I didn't.   My question is, is it common for them to take multiple samples and any idea why one would be more painful than another?  The first sample was not painful, but the second was.  He also made me nervous because, as assuring as he was at my consultation, he said nothing reassuring during the procedure.  After studying the images on the computer screen for quite some time the first biopsy, he requested more films before performing the second.   This journey started almost two weeks ago and has been the most anxiety producing time of my life.   I get the results tomorrow morning at his office.  No phone call with good news has me worried, as well.      Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Biopsy question lorimann artistang
